{ Game : D4X.exe Version: 2.0.7.31918 Date : 2024-07-18 Author : ilssear This script turns player units into super units: - Faster - Stronger attack / defense - Immmune to sandworm attack - Faster life recovery - Faster recon - Faster unit recruitment - Full supply for units }
[ENABLE] {$C NODEBUG} #include <ent.Unit..getSpeedFactor.c> #include <ent.Entity..hurtBy.c> #include <ent.Unit..canBeWormTarget.c> #include <ent.Unit..updateLife.c> #include <ent.Structure..addReconProgress.c> #include <ent.Structure..updateRecruitment.c> #include <ent.Army..get_supply.c>
{$asm} alloc(newmem_speed,$1000,$40000000) // Allocate memory for the speed function patch alloc(newmem_hurtBy,$1000,$40000000) // Allocate memory for the hurtBy function patch alloc(newmem_worm,$1000,$40000000) // Allocate memory for the sandworm function patch alloc(newmem_life,$1000,$40000000) // Allocate memory for the life function patch alloc(newmem_recon,$1000,$40000000) // Allocate memory for the recon function patch alloc(newmem_recruit,$1000,$40000000) // Allocate memory for the recruitment function patch alloc(newmem_supply,$1000,$40000000) // Allocate memory for the supply function patch
newmem_speed: reg(ent_Unit_getSpeedFactor_patch) // Register the address for the speed factor patch align 10 // Align the code to a 16-byte boundary hl_detour_method(ent.Unit:getSpeedFactor) // Detour from the original function to custom code
newmem_hurtBy: reg(ent_Entity_hurtBy_patch) // Register the address for the hurtBy patch align 10 // Align the code to a 16-byte boundary hl_detour_method(ent.Entity:hurtBy) // Detour from the original function to custom code
newmem_worm: reg(ent_Unit_canBeWormTarget_patch) // Register the address for the sandworm target patch align 10 // Align the code to a 16-byte boundary hl_detour_method(ent.Unit:canBeWormTarget) // Detour from the original function to custom code
newmem_life: reg(ent_Unit_updateLife_patch) // Register the address for the life update patch align 10 // Align the code to a 16-byte boundary hl_detour_method(ent.Unit:updateLife) // Detour from the original function to custom code
newmem_recon: reg(ent_Structure_addReconProgress_patch) // Register the address for the recon progress patch align 10 hl_detour_method(ent.Structure:addReconProgress)
newmem_recruit: reg(ent_Structure_updateRecruitment_patch) // Register the address for the recruitment patch align 10 hl_detour_method(ent.Structure:updateRecruitment)
newmem_supply: reg(ent_Army_get_supply_patch) // Register the address for the supply patch align 10 hl_detour_method(ent.Army:get_supply)
[DISABLE] hl_restore_method(ent.Unit:updateLife) // Restore the original updateLife function hl_restore_method(ent.Unit:canBeWormTarget) // Restore the original canBeWormTarget function hl_restore_method(ent.Entity:hurtBy) // Restore the original hurtBy function hl_restore_method(ent.Unit:getSpeedFactor) // Restore the original speed factor function hl_restore_method(ent.Structure:addReconProgress) // Restore the original recon progress function hl_restore_method(ent.Structure:updateRecruitment) // Restore the original recruitment function hl_restore_method(ent.Army:get_supply) // Restore the original supply function
dealloc(newmem_speed) // Deallocate the memory block for the speed function patch dealloc(newmem_hurtBy) // Deallocate the memory block for the hurtBy function patch dealloc(newmem_worm) // Deallocate the memory block for the sandworm target patch dealloc(newmem_life) // Deallocate the memory block for the life update patch dealloc(newmem_recon) // Deallocate the memory block for the recon function patch dealloc(newmem_recruit) // Deallocate the memory block for the recruitment function patch dealloc(newmem_supply) // Deallocate the memory block for the supply function patch
unreg(ent_Unit_getSpeedFactor_patch) // Unregister the speed factor patch label unreg(ent_Entity_hurtBy_patch) // Unregister the hurtBy patch label unreg(ent_Unit_canBeWormTarget_patch) // Unregister the sandworm target patch label unreg(ent_Unit_updateLife_patch) // Unregister the life update patch label unreg(ent_Structure_addReconProgress_patch) // Unregister the recon progress patch label unreg(ent_Structure_updateRecruitment_patch) // Unregister the recruitment patch label unreg(ent_Army_get_supply_patch) // Unregister the supply patch label

{ Game : D4X.exe Version: 2.0.7.31918 Date : 2024-07-20 Author : ilssear This script initializes the values for resources. Most of these change the increment, except for Water and Fuel Cell, which change the actual value.
It uses the structure ent_Faction_getCachedResNetProd_data } [ENABLE]
{$lua} local rc = { [00] = { "Stockpile (spice) [no effect?]" }, [01] = { "Solari", 10000 }, [02] = { "Plascrete", 9999 }, [03] = { "Manpower", 10001 }, [04] = { "Fuel Cell", 10002 }, [05] = { "Water", 7000 }, [06] = { "Authority", 77777 }, [07] = { "Hegemony", 777 }, [08] = { "Landsraad Standing", 88888 }, [09] = { "Knowledge",100000 }, [10] = { "Influence", 10000 }, [12] = { "Votes", 10000 }, [13] = { "Command Points (Military)", 222 }, [14] = { "Military slots (max trainable troops)", 12 }, [18] = { "Spaceship parts (Fremen)", 7 }, [41] = { "Intel", 555 }, } local plus = getAddress("ent_Faction_getCachedResNetProd_data+00") printf("[INFO] Initializer - Settings (pointer): 0x%012X", plus) local plusLen = 64 for i = 0, plusLen - 1 do local r = rc[i] if not r then r = { "?", i } elseif not r[2] then r[2] = 0 end writeDouble(plus + 8 * i, r[2]) end
{$asm}
[DISABLE]
